title: Ticket #7136: Add Google Drive multifile transfer plugin
description: Just as in #7007, but this time for Google Drive. Starting off with download only, will create another ticket for upload.
remarks:
2019-Jun-28 11:37:03 by jpatton:
Note that the overall Google API requires applications (i.e. the API client registered by the schedd sysadmin) to select the scopes they allow (e.g. Google Drive - All Files or Google Drive - Application-only Files) and the API also requires user to scope their token requests. To access any file in one's Google Drive (assuming the admin has configured their application properly): 

use_oauth_services = drive
drive_oauth_permissions = https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive

2019-Jul-01 07:55:07 by bbockelm:
At the risk of bikeshedding --

Can we use a different identifier than just "drive"? I'm worried it's a bit ambiguous and may lead to future namespace collisions (OneDrive).

What about "google"? "gdrive"?

2019-Jul-10 10:24:24 by jpatton:
Added upload capability in [57368].

I'm certainly not tied to "drive" as the name. Some consistency would be nice whether or not we always prepend the company name to the storage product (google_drive, microsoft_onedrive, etc.) to disambiguate similar sounding products. Maybe we should pick the brains of the RCFs to see how/if we should change the name.

2019-Jul-12 14:22:31 by jpatton:
Renamed "drive" to "gdrive", per Brian's comment and feedback from RCFs. Next step is to add the plugin to the default config and add the file to the packaging.
